verses.roman:
tīrthera mahimā, nija bhakte ātmasāt
eka līlāya karena prabhu kārya pāṅca-sāta

synonyms: tīrthera mahimā—the glories of a holy place; nija bhakte ātmasāt—accepting His devotee again; eka līlāya—by one pastime; karena—executes; prabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; kārya pāṅca-sāta—five to seven different purposes.
translation: It also demonstrates the glories of holy places and shows how the Lord accepts His faithful devotee. Thus the Lord fulfilled five or seven purposes by performing one pastime.
